content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting and fun.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: With the set of all suggested modifications, now it is okay ;)

The explanation with ascii is completely useless. Just you can say for each letter switch it in alphabetical order of the number of occurence. Valid computation could not pass through ascii representation.

If you correct this point and if you also mentionned the cyclic aspect of the alphabet, you can extend your CoC to others mode (this would be better).

Note also that special character, as space, slash, etc ... are lower case characters. So your input/outpu should be lower case letter instead of lower case characters
I tend to agree with blop200. Maybe a sort only reverse is a better proposal.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: It's simple and fun.

But I think you aren't specific enough. You didn't specify that you can only use letters, and not any other given characters. And if the new character value corresponds to a non-letter, you need to loopback to return to a letter. None of the test-cases showed this, only the validators did.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun little reverse puzzle

Very true, the looping back is not shown on the test...
Hmm would you.
I want to restrict it to lowercase characters because if not it can be annoying to debug for the players.
I am changing the last test to show that you have to loopback if needed.
Sort and reverse the string is a good reverse too. I might also do it, but I think both can exist

Indeed. Talking about ascii values is useless, I removed it ans also added an example.
I also extended to clash to other modes, this is indeed better.
True for the lowercase characters. I replaced it with lower case letter which is is indeed more precise.

Really better than at the beginning.
It remains 3 points :

- Harmonize input and output to have same shape of the description. You can give a name to the output variable (for instance "a string [[result]] composed by only lowercase letters")
- Normally the first test is exactly the given exemple in the description. So change the presented test, or add a first test/validator will be better.
- Precise contrainst : Tell about the maximal size of the manipulated string
Great feedback, thank you. I fixed it.

In your stub :
- If the length of the word is 100, so put 100 to the length of string
- If your result is named "result", write "write result" instead of "write answer"
